ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Through this course we learned real world applications of machine learning algorithms. With exposure to industry and academia from guest speakers and student presentations, we learned a lot about the cutting edge within the field.

This class was based on student presentations of research topics in applies machine learning. For our midterm projects, we got to implement an ML algorithm and model on a specific application (e.g., breast histopathology data), which I really enjoyed!
Read SOTA paper in different areas and conduct elimentary research on selected topics
I learned about machine learning, both conceptually and theoretically, as well as how it is being studied and applied in industry and academia.
General familiarity with various ML fields, reading ML papers, presentation & project skills
learned a lot through the projects for midterm and final and paper presentation. very independent learning I enjoyed

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course was very unique in that it actually introduced real-world applications, outside of the classroom. I really enjoyed it thoroughly. I think it would be nice to have a few more guest speakers if possible.

This course is a great seminar-style class for students experienced with machine learning, where you get to showcase your research interests (you get to select the topic you present on and do you projects on) and learn about new topics from other students and guest lecturers. Prof. van Dijk and Antonio (the TF) were both responsive with feedback about assignments. No weaknesses as far as I could see!

I think this course is exciting because it not only encourages us to go deep in one selected topic that we are interested, but also give us opportunities to learn from others' presentation. And I believe it would be better if the assignment discriptions can be more detailed.

As someone with previous ML research experience, the course provided a good way for me to explore my existing interests in ML. However, for someone who is entirely new to this topic, I could see how the free-form structure of the course could feel confusing.
More background around each of the models and applications presented (including of student presentations and projects)
weakness: some guest speakers and students weren't that engaging when they present. strengths: very diverse ideas presented and get to work on what we are interested in

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this course to another student interested in machine learning, who already has some exposure to the field.

Yes, if you have experience with machine learning and/or research. A good informal prerequisite might be CPSC 452 (Deep Learning). This course serves great as a seminar-style class where you can work on topics you're interested in, but I can see how it might be intimidating to someone with no prior experience in ML. (For those with prior experience, it's great because there's no rehash of the same topics you learn in other AI electives  you get to dive right in to the new research topics!)
I would certainly recommend this course to someone who has previous ML experience (e.g., lab, internship) and wants to get a chance to meet very cool people in academia and industry.
Yes, but only if you have some background knowledge.
yes. great professor and ta, and a different experience from courses where the professors just lecture. this was very indepdentn and hands on

extras.title: CPSC 482 01/CPSC 582 01 - Current Topics in Applied ML
